alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Langlade (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 1:00PM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT... .A strong winter system will move north into the Great Lakes tonight. Light snow will start in the area after midnight, spreading across the area through Tuesday morning. Accumulations by Tuesday will be fairly light, with snow becoming moderate to heavy later in the day Tuesday morning through Tuesday afternoon. The bulk of the snow will fall Tuesday afternoon and evening. Winds then increase in the late afternoon and evening, reducing visibility as snow falls. Lake enhancement could boost totals along the lakeshore. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Langlade, Florence, and Forest Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM Tuesday to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
